title: Integrating Cultural Diversity Strategies for Design Education: Mobile Microlearning Course

context.prior_knowledge: Possession of foundational design theory and practical experience
context.additional_context: Practical strategies for science field practitioners to integrate cultural diversity into design education

learning_goals: Learners can analyze and explain non-Western design perspectives through case studies of Yoruba, Gujarati, and Algerian contexts.
Learners can integrate cultural diversity into their own educational content by applying inclusion, contribution, and transformation approaches.
Learners can design instructional modules using the ACT-R theory-based three-stage (cognitive-associative-autonomous) learning model.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
